meanings.definition: A temporary state of mind or feeling.
meanings.sent1: Her happy mood lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent2: I woke up in a good mood today.
meanings.sent3: His grumpy mood made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds matched the somber mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The tense mood in the air was palpable.

meanings.definition: The atmosphere or prevailing emotional tone of a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The cozy cafe had a warm mood that welcomed customers.
meanings.sent2: The eerie mood of the forest gave me chills.
meanings.sent3: The playful mood of the party was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room created a heavy mood.
meanings.sent5: The celebratory mood at the concert was electric.
